intro: Triaristellina trichaete, commonly known as the hairy triaristellina, is a lesser-known species within the fungal kingdom. It belongs to the family Tricholomataceae and is characterized by its unique, hairy texture on the cap and stem. The fungus typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often associated with decaying wood or leaf litter. Its spore-producing structures, called gills, are closely spaced and often exhibit a pale to ochre coloration. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is not commonly encountered in the wild.
